revised_title: The Influence of Magnetic Fields on Radiation Frequency and Spectral Lines
tldr: The authors investigate the effects of magnetic fields on radiation frequency and spectral lines using a concave Rowland grating. They observe that the dark reversal line in sodium spectra disappears when a magnetic field is applied, and that the effect is proportional to the wavelength. The study also reveals that the magnetic effect is better seen when a nicol is interposed in the path of the light, but is cut off when the nicol is rotated 90 degrees.
